0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify imported goods against commercial invoices to ensure accuracy and compliance.
Prepare and submit export declarations to customs authorities in a timely manner.
Investigate shipment details to identify potential clearance issues or discrepancies.
Negotiate with clients to resolve any customs-related disputes or concerns.
Facilitate communication between importers/exporters, carriers, and government agencies.
Coordinate with customs brokers' associations to stay informed about regulatory changes.
Maintain accurate records of shipments, including documentation and filing history.
Ensure compliance with export regulations, laws, and international standards.
Conduct on-site inspections at shipping facilities or warehouses as needed.
Provide clients with regular updates on shipment status and customs clearance progress.
Prepare and file necessary permits, licenses, and certifications for imports/exportations.
Analyze commercial invoices to identify potential value-added taxes (VAT) implications.
Negotiate discounts or other concessions with suppliers on behalf of importers.
Collaborate with freight forwarders to resolve any issues related to shipment handling.
Monitor compliance with environmental regulations and sustainable trade practices.
Prepare and submit post-clearance audits for imported goods as required by regulatory bodies.
Communicate with clients regarding changes in tariffs, taxes, or other trade-related policies.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.
Coordinate clearance procedures at borders or seaports on behalf of clients.
Manage and resolve claims related to customs clearance issues or discrepancies.
Create and maintain accurate documentation for client records, including customs forms and bills of lading.
1: Develop and implement training programs to enhance employees' skills and knowledge, aligning with organizational goals and objectives.
Conduct needs assessments to identify training gaps and opportunities for professional growth within the organization.
Create engaging and interactive learning experiences through various formats, such as workshops, webinars, and e-learning modules.
Evaluate the effectiveness of existing training programs, identifying areas for improvement and implementing changes to optimize results.
Design and deliver training sessions on new technologies, processes, or industry trends, ensuring a high level of knowledge transfer among employees.
Develop and maintain training materials, including manuals, guides, and other supporting documents, in compliance with organizational standards and best practices.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to create customized training content that meets the specific needs of various departments and teams within the organization.
Create a learning management system (LMS) that tracks employee progress, assesses skills, and provides opportunities for continuous professional development.
Facilitate training sessions and workshops, using presentation skills and interpersonal abilities to engage participants and promote knowledge sharing.
Conduct coaching and mentoring programs to support employees in applying new skills and knowledge to their daily work, promoting a culture of continuous learning and growth.
Develop strategic plans for talent development and succession planning, identifying internal and external talent pipelines and opportunities for upskilling and reskilling.
2: Prepare and cook menu items according to institutional guidelines.
Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment, adhering to health and safety regulations.
Order supplies and ingredients for inventory management, ensuring adequate stock levels.
Collaborate with catering teams to plan and execute large-scale events and functions.
Develop new recipes and menus to cater to changing customer preferences and dietary requirements.
Supervise and mentor junior cooks and kitchen staff to ensure competence and efficiency.
Conduct food safety checks and audits to ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
Plan and manage inventory control, minimizing waste and excess stock.
Prepare and serve meals in a timely manner, meeting customer expectations for quality and presentation.
Maintain accurate records of menu items, recipes, and inventory levels.
Perform cleaning and sanitizing tasks, including equipment, utensils, and workstations.
Implement energy-efficient practices and reduce waste in kitchen operations to minimize environmental impact.
